sense.name: Spray or sprinkle with.
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1(agent) SHOWER NP2(patient) PP(recipient/goal) NP1(agent) SHOWER NP2(patient) PP(with) NP3(instrument)
sense.examples: The guests showered rice on the couple. Campaign organizers showered the crowd with balloons.

sense.name: Expend profusely (on), also used with abstract nouns; provide abundantly with.d
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare with Sense 1; Sense 2 is not a literal showering.
sense.examples: He was showered with praise. He showered her with presents.

sense.name: Take a shower; wash one's body in the shower.
sense.examples: You should shower after vigorous exercise. John faithfully showers once a month.

sense.name: Rain abundantly.
sense.examples: Meteors showered down over half of Australia. It showered yesterday.
